lines.text: Boy, I'm lucky. Do you know when I first found out I was lucky?
When?
When I entered the "Send in a Poochy Pup Dog Food jingle for the Poochy Pup Dog Food" jingle contest. You wanna hear how it goes?
No, but I will.
[on his jingle]
You like it?
I think it'll live forever. Maybe longer!
[his jingle, to the tune of "Rock-a-bye Baby"]
I eat Poochy Pup Dog Food outta the can / It makes me eat my food just like a man / My coat is so glossy, shiny and bright / My master can find me in the middle of the night!
[last lines]

[to Mr. Bascomb the dog]
May I have your autograph, please?
[the dog signs]
Oh, wonderful! Thank you!

[referring to sexy movie star Anita Ekberg]
Do I know her? She drives me crazy!

[obviously excited]
Me too!
She keeps coming to my back door and wants to borrow a couple of cups of sugar...
Sugar? That's nice, yeah!
...a couple eggs...
Oh, eggs! Good!
I go over to her place - I borrow a grapefruit or two...

[aroused by the metaphor]
Oh, that's cute!

[getting into the car]
You're a dear sweet young man.
[seeing the dog]
Oh my, does he bite?

[laconically]
Only me lady.

[watching Malcolm blow on the dice]
Don't drown 'em - just make snake eyes!
But remember, I'd have never known about the phony ticket or the stealing if you didn't tell me, which means you're very noble. You're as noble as Abraham Lincoln or Raymond Massey.

[to Malcolm]
I'm thinkin' of somethin'. I'm thinkin' of double homicide - one for each of your heads!
